rev.comment: /* Bankruptcy and liquidation */ added quotes to quotation
/* Bankruptcy and liquidation */ wrong caption - I took this photo and it was in portland, or. nonetheless, location is not importlant
/* Bankruptcy and liquidation */ rm superfluous data
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.125.183.212|24.125.183.212]] ([[User talk:24.125.183.212|talk]]) to last version by Rjwilmsi
/* Bankruptcy and liquidation */ spell ebay -> eBay, expand citation info
date comma spacing fixes + gen fixes using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* External links */ claims to be an official site
/* External links */ Adding "The Source" back. I didn't realize what it was when I removed it. I thought it was linkspam.
/* External links */ Adding Circuit City official corporate history, which I retrieved from their website for Wikipedia use right before they went under.
/* Downturn */ -Corrected Minimum wage, as federal min. wage was never at 6.50, rather it was 6.55
/* Real estate */ - Seen news pieces about H.H.Gregg, an Indianoplis-based retailer, also expanding into areas left vacant by Circuit City, thus added a blurb to the "retail" secton of the article
Restore foundation date back to correct date of 1949

Can't change the name of the field in an infobox. Also, Systemax did not buy out Circuit City Stores, Inc., but only the assets. Buying out the whole would have bought the debts that made CCTYQ insolvent.
Reverted to revision 311900541 by [[Special:Contributions/Welsh|Welsh]]; not how it works. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
retitle it to "media" so that we can generally talk about all books talking about CC, rm fluff (find sources to back the popularity of th book)
Introducing a free eBook about mistakes Circuit City has made along its journey that eventually drove them out of business
Since CC still exists in the form of a website, so I changed ''was'' to ''is''.
/* Bankruptcy and liquidation */ Corrected spelling of possitive to positive
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], typos fixed: sucess → success using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]

/* History */ separate section on "new e-commerce site" is both unnecessary & inappropriate; merging this into the bankrupcy section.
rm split tag for circuitcity.com (not appropriate, circuitcity.com is owned by [[Systemax]], and there's already an article for that).
This really should be two articles, but if consensus demands one article, I will try to make it clear that this article refers to two completely distinct entities that share nothing but the name.
[[WP:RBK|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Jesse Viviano|Jesse Viviano]] ([[User talk:Jesse Viviano|talk]]) to last version by 139.182.35.73
removing inappropriate comment on "defunct" date in infobox (the company is no longer operating. the website is operating, but no longer as this company, it was bought by another)
Pompeii isn't there any more either, doesn't mean we gut the Pompeii article.
/* Business model */ Again...this is old news/no longer relevant...the stores aren't there anymore
/* Business model */ Old news/no longer relevant...the stores no longer exist.
/* The New Circuit City */ change title to 'new e-commerce site to agree with [[WP:MOS]]
/* The New Circuit City */ integrate info from the [[CircuitCity.com]] article

Corrections to inaccurate information in captions. The Rome, GA store was built in 2000 as a "Horizon" store. Yellow came after white and was used from 2004-2007.
eliminating repetitive information in opening pgh
